newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico peso speculation eases slightly mid-morning.
newsitem.headline: Mexico peso speculation eases slightly mid-morning.

text.p: Pressure on Mexican peso contracts had eased slightly by mid-morning on Thursday.
Nonetheless, the peso was still toying with the eight-per-dollar mark as the market braced itself for the U.S. House of Representatives vote on decertifying Mexico as a drug war ally, traders said.
"The peso opened under great pressure, then some stepped in to sell (dollars)," a trader said.
The benchmark 48-hour peso and its 24-hour counterpart stood 3.2 and 2.5 centavos weaker, respectively, at 7.9980/8.0020 and 7.9860/7.9910 per dollar.
